================================
**Public Tender Notice**
--------------------------------
**Title:** RISO - Hazardous Material Abatement
**Procurement Number:** W684H-220063/C
**Publication Date:** September 23, 2022
**Tender Closing Date:** October 18, 2022 at 1:00 pm
**Concurrent Notice Type:** Demand for Proposal

**Notice Description:**
The Department of National Defence, in conjunction with Public Works and Government Services Canada, invites interested suppliers to submit a bid for the removal and disposal of hazardous materials at a military facility in Nova Scotia. The project requires the provision of all necessary labour, materials, tools, equipment, and supervision, as well as obtaining necessary permits for transportation and disposal.

**Trade Agreement:**
This tender aligns with the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and various free trade agreements.

**Procurement Method:**
Competitive Procurement Strategy will be used for this bid. The lowest bidder will be selected.

**Deliverables:**
The contract requires the supplier to provide all necessary services, including removal and disposal of hazardous materials, in accordance with applicable regulations and standards.

**Tender Submission:**
Interested suppliers are invited to submit a bid, following the offer preparation instructions outlined in the solicitation document. The bid must be submitted electronically through CanadaBuys, with supporting documents attached.

**Contact Information:**
For any technical or contractual inquiries, please contact Mariam Assal via email at mariam.assal@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca, or by phone at (902) 233-0685. Facsimile numbers are also available.

**Notes:**
Please note that this tender is part of Public Services and Procurement Canada’s initiative to submit bid submission files electronically using CPC Connect. Suppliers are encouraged to use the service to transmit their bid. Proposals will not be accepted if emailed directly.

** Language:**
The tender documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. Delivery dates and other requirements are as indicated above. 
================================
